newsitem.title: JAPAN: All Tokyo corn futures end sharply lower.
newsitem.headline: All Tokyo corn futures end sharply lower.

text.p: Tokyo corn futures closed sharply lower across the board on Monday due to losses on the Chicago market on Friday and the stronger yen against the dollar, traders said.
Prices were 350 to 530 yen lower, with the benchmark January 1998 contract down 530 yen at 15,160 yen per tonne. The day's volume was 173,767 lots.

Heavy selling from local investors battered the market from the opening, traders said. "Some investors actively liquidated long positions," one trader said. The maximum daily price movement was extended to 700 yen from today.
The spot March contract on the CBOT Project A trading system was being traded at $2.69-1/4 per bushel at 0810 GMT, unchanged from Friday's close.
The spot March of the CBOT soybean futures on the overnight trading system was at $7.32-1/2 at 0810 GMT, down from $7.38-1/4 at Friday's close.
